ud2.9:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in the Eastern Monastery, the stilt longhouse of Migāra’s mother.
ud2.9:1.3: Now at that time Visākhā was caught up in some business with King Pasenadi.
ud2.9:1.4: But the king’s settlement did not meet her expectations.
ud2.9:2.1: Then, in the middle of the day, she went to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down.
ud2.9:2.3: “So, Visākhā, where are you coming from in the middle of the day?”
ud2.9:2.4: “Sir, I am caught up in some business with King Pasenadi.
ud2.9:2.5: But the king’s settlement did not meet my expectations.”
ud2.9:3.1: Then, understanding this matter, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ud2.9:4.2: all under one’s own authority is pleasing;
ud2.9:4.3: what’s shared is stressful for both parties,
ud2.9:4.4: for bonds are hard to escape.”
